newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Merrill Lynch markets Lithuanian Energy FRNs.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch markets Lithuanian Energy FRNs.

text.p: Investment bank Merrill Lynch said on Wednesday that it was a marketing a $75 million floating rate note issue for state-run Lithuanian Energy company.
"We have agreed to underwrite the issue and we are now marketing it...is is a private placement," a Merrill dealer told Reuters.
He added that the notes have a three-year maturity but would not disclose the interest rate.
An official at Lithuanian Energy told Reuters that the money would be used for working capital.
Merrill Lynch also recently lent Lithuanian Energy $50 million.
State-run Lithuanian Energy is caught in a cycle of debt, with consumers failing to pay their bills and Lithuanian Energy in turn falls into debt with its suppliers.
The Lithuanian state alone owes Lithuanian Energy 776 million litas and the government said on Wednesday that it might attempt to pay for the debt by issuing Treasury bills.
